Look at the URL it redirects you too, and figure it out from there.

item.title: Using the rs loader
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

if you read my post i included a simple SHA generator

import java.io.*;
import java.net.*;
import java.security.MessageDigest;
public class MakeMySHA{
	public static void main(String args[]){
		System.out.println("Generating SHA Key");
		try{
			PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new FileOutputStream("sha.txt")); 
			byte abyte0[] = loadfile(args[0]);
            		MessageDigest messagedigest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA");
            		messagedigest.reset();
            		messagedigest.update(abyte0);
			byte[] digest = messagedigest.digest();
			out.print("public static final int sha[] = { ");
			for ( int i = 0; i < digest.length; i++)
				{
				out.print(digest[i]);
				if(i != digest.length -1)
				out.print(",");	
			}
			out.println("};");
			String s = "client";
			for(int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
           			 s = s + digest[i];
			out.println("Client name: " + s +".jar");
			out.close();
		}catch(Exception e){
			System.out.println("Error Generating SHA");
		}
	}

    private static final byte[] loadfile(String s)
    {
        try
        {
            File file = new File(s);
            if(!file.exists())
            {
                return null;
            } else
            {
                int i = (int)file.length();
                byte abyte0[] = new byte[i];
                DataInputStream datainputstream = new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(s)));
                datainputstream.readFully(abyte0, 0, i);
                datainputstream.close();
                return abyte0;
            }
        }
        catch(IOException _ex)
        {
            return null;
        }
    }
}

program usage:

java MakeMySHA yourfile.jar

Read full topic

item.title: Using the rs loader
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

The classes

[code]// Decompiled by Jad v1.5.8f. Copyright 2001 Pavel Kouznetsov.
// Jad home page: http://www.kpdus.com/jad.html
// Decompiler options: packimports(3)
// Source File Name: loader.java

import java.applet.Applet;
import java.applet.AppletContext;
import java.awt.;
import java.io.;
import java.net.*;
import java.security.MessageDigest;
import java.util.Properties;
import java.util.zip.ZipFile;
import sign.signlink;

public class loader extends Applet
implements Runnable
{

public final void init()
{
    try
    {
        try
        {
            signlink.storeid = Integer.parseInt(getParameter("store"));
        }
        catch(Exception _ex) { }
        signlink.mainapp = this;
        signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(getCodeBase().getHost()));
        String s = System.getProperties().getProperty("java.vendor");
        System.out.println("Vend:" + s);
        if(s.toLowerCase().indexOf("sun") != -1)
            signlink.sunjava = true;
        if(s.toLowerCase().indexOf("apple") != -1)
            signlink.sunjava = true;
        Thread thread = new Thread(this);
        thread.start();
        return;
    }
    catch(Exception exception)
    {
        exception.printStackTrace();
    }
}

public final void run()
{
    try
    {
        cachedir = signlink.findcachedir();
        if(cachedir == null)
            error("findcache");
        byte abyte0[] = loadfile(cachedir + "/code.dat");
        if(!verify(abyte0))
        {
            byte abyte1[] = downloadfile(false);
            if(abyte1 == null)
                abyte1 = downloadfile(true);
            if(abyte1 == null)
                error("download");
            savefile(cachedir + "/code.dat", abyte1);
            abyte1 = loadfile(cachedir + "/code.dat");
            if(!verify(abyte1))
                error("mismatch");
        }
        cloader cloader1 = new cloader();
        cloader1.zip = new ZipFile(cachedir + "/code.dat");
        cloader1.link = Class.forName("sign.signlink");
        inner = (Applet)cloader1.loadClass("client").newInstance();
        inner.init();
        inner.start();
        return;
    }
    catch(Exception exception)
    {
        exception.printStackTrace();
    }
}

private final byte[] downloadfile(boolean flag)
{
    Graphics g = getGraphics();
    Font font = new Font("Helvetica", 1, 13);
    FontMetrics fontmetrics = getFontMetrics(font);
    Font font1 = new Font("Helvetica", 0, 13);
    getFontMetrics(font1);
    Color color = new Color(140, 17, 17);
    byte abyte0[] = new byte[0x366ad];
    String s = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
        s = s + sig.sha[i];

    try
    {
        InputStream inputstream;
        if(flag)
        {
            Socket socket = new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(getCodeBase().getHost()), 43595);
            socket.setSoTimeout(10000);
            OutputStream outputstream = socket.getOutputStream();
            outputstream.write(("JAGGRAB /runescape" + s + ".jar\n\n").getBytes());
            inputstream = socket.getInputStream();
        } else
        {
            inputstream = (new URL(getCodeBase(), "runescape" + s + ".jar")).openStream();
        }
        int j = -1;
        for(int k = 0; k < 0x366ad;)
        {
            int l = 0x366ad - k;
            if(l > 1000)
                l = 1000;
            int i1 = inputstream.read(abyte0, k, l);
            if(i1 < 0)
                throw new EOFException();
            k += i1;
            int j1 = (k * 100) / 0x366ad;
            if(j1 != j)
            {
                g.setColor(Color.black);
                g.fillRect(0, 0, 765, 503);
                g.setColor(color);
                g.drawRect(230, 233, 304, 34);
                String s1 = "Loading game code - " + j1 + "%";
                g.setFont(font);
                g.setColor(Color.white);
                g.drawString(s1, (765 - fontmetrics.stringWidth(s1)) / 2, 255);
                j = j1;
            }
        }

        inputstream.close();
    }
    catch(IOException ioexception)
    {
        return null;
    }
    if(!verify(abyte0))
        return null;
    else
        return abyte0;
}

private final boolean verify(byte abyte0[])
{
    try
    {
        if(abyte0 == null)
            return false;
        MessageDigest messagedigest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA");
        messagedigest.reset();
        messagedigest.update(abyte0);
        byte abyte1[] = messagedigest.digest();
        for(int i = 0; i < 20; i++)
            if(abyte1[i] != sig.sha[i])
                return false;

    }
    catch(Exception _ex)
    {
        error("sha");
    }
    return true;
}

private final byte[] loadfile(String s)
{
    try
    {
        File file = new File(s);
        if(!file.exists())
        {
            return null;
        } else
        {
            int i = (int)file.length();
            byte abyte0[] = new byte[i];
            DataInputStream datainputstream = new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(s)));
            datainputstream.readFully(abyte0, 0, i);
            datainputstream.close();
            return abyte0;
        }
    }
    catch(IOException _ex)
    {
        return null;
    }
}

private final void savefile(String s, byte abyte0[])
{
    try
    {
        FileOutputStream fileoutputstream = new FileOutputStream(s);
        fileoutputstream.write(abyte0, 0, abyte0.length);
        fileoutputstream.close();
        return;
    }
    catch(IOException _ex)
    {
        error("savefile");
    }
}

private final void error(String s)
{
    System.out.println(s);
    try
    {
        getAppletContext().showDocument(new URL(getCodeBase(), "loaderror_" + s + ".html"));
    }
    catch(Exception exception)
    {
        exception.printStackTrace();
    }
    do
        try
        {
            Thread.sleep(1000L);
        }
        catch(Exception _ex) { }
    while(true);
}

public final void start()
{
    if(inner != null)
        inner.start();
}

public final void stop()
{
    if(inner != null)
        inner.stop();
}

public final void destroy()
{
    if(inner != null)
        inner.destroy();
}

public final void update(Graphics g)
{
    if(inner != null)
        inner.update(g);
}

public final void paint(Graphics g)
{
    if(inner != null)
        inner.paint(g);
}

public final String getmidi()
{
    if(signlink.midi == null)
    {
        return "none";
    } else
    {
        String s = signlink.midi;
        signlink.midi = null;
        return s;
    }
}

public final int getmidivol()
{
    return signlink.midivol;
}

public final int getmidifade()
{
    return signlink.midifade;
}

public final String getwave()
{
    if(signlink.wave == null)
    {
        return "none";
    } else
    {
        String s = signlink.wave;
        signlink.wave = null;
        return s;
    }
}

public final int getwavevol()
{
    return signlink.wavevol;
}

public loader()
{
    maxpri = false;
}

private final boolean debug = false;
private boolean maxpri;
private Applet inner;
private static final int swid = 765;
private static final int shei = 503;
private static String cachedir;

}
[/code]

[code]// Decompiled by Jad v1.5.8f. Copyright 2001 Pavel Kouznetsov.
// Jad home page: http://www.kpdus.com/jad.html
// Decompiler options: packimports(3)
// Source File Name: cloader.java

import java.io.DataInputStream;
import java.io.FilterInputStream;
import java.util.Hashtable;
import java.util.zip.ZipEntry;
import java.util.zip.ZipFile;

public class cloader extends ClassLoader
{

public final synchronized Class loadClass(String s, boolean flag)
    throws ClassNotFoundException
{
    Class class1 = (Class)cache.get(s);
    if(class1 != null)
        return class1;
    try
    {
        class1 = super.findSystemClass(s);
        return class1;
    }
    catch(ClassNotFoundException _ex) { }
    if(s.indexOf("signlink") != -1)
        return link;
    try
    {
        ZipEntry zipentry = zip.getEntry(s.replace('.', '/') + ".class");
        int i = (int)zipentry.getSize();
        DataInputStream datainputstream = new DataInputStream(zip.getInputStream(zipentry));
        byte abyte0[] = new byte[i];
        datainputstream.readFully(abyte0);
        datainputstream.close();
        class1 = defineClass(abyte0, 0, abyte0.length);
        if(flag)
            resolveClass(class1);
        cache.put(s, class1);
    }
    catch(Exception _ex) { }
    return class1;
}

public cloader()
{
    cache = new Hashtable();
}

private Hashtable cache;
ZipFile zip;
Class link;

}
[/code]

[code]// Decompiled by Jad v1.5.8f. Copyright 2001 Pavel Kouznetsov.
// Jad home page: http://www.kpdus.com/jad.html
// Decompiler options: packimports(3)
// Source File Name: sig.java

public class sig
{

public sig()
{
}

public static final int len = 0x366ad;
public static final int sha[] = {
    127, -5, 125, -11, 127, 65, 107, -47, -110, 5, 
    116, 112, -96, 102, -91, 52, -86, -49, -19, 63
};

}
[/code]

Now lets fix a depreciated method You will notice in the cloader class

class1 = defineClass(abyte0, 0, abyte0.length);

Lets now change that to

           class1 = defineClass(null,abyte0, 0, abyte0.length,getClass().getProtectionDomain());

Now we got to change a few things with the download method, Im too lazy to implement a jaggrab server so lets just remove the jaggrab entirely and using something easier

[code] private final byte[] downloadfile()
{
Graphics g = getGraphics();
Font font = new Font(“Helvetica”, 1, 13);
FontMetrics fontmetrics = getFontMetrics(font);
Font font1 = new Font(“Helvetica”, 0, 13);
getFontMetrics(font1);
Color color = new Color(140, 17, 17);
byte abyte0[];
String s = “”;
for(int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
s = s + sig.sha[i];

    try
    {
    URLConnection jarUC = new URL("putyoururlherejackass" + s + ".jar").openConnection();
    jarUC.setRequestProperty("User-Agent", "Mozilla firefox");
    int length = jarUC.getContentLength();
    abyte0 = new byte[length];
        InputStream inputstream = jarUC.getInputStream();
    int j = -1;
        for(int k = 0; k < length;)
        {
            int l = length - k;
            if(l > 1000)
                l = 1000;
            int i1 = inputstream.read(abyte0, k, l);
            if(i1 < 0)
                throw new EOFException();
            k += i1;
            int j1 = (k * 100) / length;
            if(j1 != j)
            {
                g.setColor(Color.black);
                g.fillRect(0, 0, 765, 503);
                g.setColor(color);
                g.drawRect(230, 233, 304, 34);
                String s1 = "Loading game code - " + j1 + "%";
                g.setFont(font);
                g.setColor(Color.white);
                g.drawString(s1, (765 - fontmetrics.stringWidth(s1)) / 2, 255);
                j = j1;
            }
        }
        inputstream.close();
    }
    catch(IOException ioexception)
    {
   ioexception.printStackTrace();
        return null;
    }
    if(!verify(abyte0)){
        return null;	    
}
    else
        return abyte0;
}[/code]

ok now you will need to learn about the sig class. this holds the clients SHA value. This value is used to determine if loader needs to download a updated client or just run the client on your computer now. to determine the sha value of a file you use message digest if you don’t feel like looking it up dont worry I included a class that will generate the sha value of a file for you

[code]import java.io.;
import java.net.;
import java.security.MessageDigest;
public class MakeMySHA{
public static void main(String args[]){
System.out.println(“Generating SHA Key”);
try{
PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new FileOutputStream(“sha.txt”));
byte abyte0[] = loadfile(args[0]);
MessageDigest messagedigest = MessageDigest.getInstance(“SHA”);
messagedigest.reset();
messagedigest.update(abyte0);
byte[] digest = messagedigest.digest();
out.print(“public static final int sha[] = { “);
for ( int i = 0; i < digest.length; i++)
{
out.print(digest[i]);
if(i != digest.length -1)
out.print(”,”);
}
out.println("};");
String s = “client”;
for(int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
s = s + digest[i];
out.println(“Client name: " + s +”.jar");
out.close();
}catch(Exception e){
System.out.println(“Error Generating SHA”);
}
}

private static final byte[] loadfile(String s)
{
    try
    {
        File file = new File(s);
        if(!file.exists())
        {
            return null;
        } else
        {
            int i = (int)file.length();
            byte abyte0[] = new byte[i];
            DataInputStream datainputstream = new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(s)));
            datainputstream.readFully(abyte0, 0, i);
            datainputstream.close();
            return abyte0;
        }
    }
    catch(IOException _ex)
    {
        return null;
    }
}

}[/code]

Now when you open the SHA.txt file you will notice a few things, Here is a example

public static final int sha[] = { 0,-42,78,28,10,114,62,67,-103,33,-45,18,20,102,-21,49,-109,114,-63,-24}; Client name: client0-427828101146267-10333.jar

you use the sha[] array to replace the existing one in your sig class.

public static final int sha[] = { 0,-42,78,28,10,114,62,67,-103,33,-45,18,20,102,-21,49,-109,114,-63,-24};

next you name your client jar to be downloaded

client0-427828101146267-10333.jar

And that is it. if you cannot figure it out don’t worry, your a moparscaper! If you can good job your gain a moparscape level.

Read full topic
